titles: A letter to Rome, to declare to ye Pope, Iohn Felton his freend is hangd in a rope and farther, a right his grace to enforme, he dyed a papist, and seemd not to turne. To the tune of Row well ye mariners.
author: Peele, Steven.
publisher: Imprinted by Alexander Lacie for Henrie Kyrkham, dwelling at the signe of the blacke Boy: at the middle north dore of Paules church,
notes: A song - "Who keepes Saint Angell gates?".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Felton, John, d. 1570 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
Catholic Church --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
